a(lleluia?). ä. alleluia.
Similabo
eu(m) eū eum vi⸗

to petition the Most High. Response. The Lord guided the just in direct ways, showed him the kingdom of God. In [direct ways.] Glory [be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Ghost. As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end.] [The Lord guided] the just. Versicle. The just [man will give his heart to seek the Lord, his Maker, to petition the Most High.] At ix. Little chapter. The Lord guided the just in direct ways, showed him the kingdom of God, and gave him knowledge of holy things; He prospered him in his labors and made abundant the fruit of his works. Response. The just man shall flourish like the palm tree. In the house of the Lord. Versicle. He shall grow up like the cedar in Lebanon. In [the house of the Lord.] Glory [be to the Father, and to the Son, and to the Holy Ghost. As it was in the beginning, is now, and ever shall be, world without end.] The just [man shall flourish like the palm tree.] Versicle. The just [man shall spring up as a lily, and shall flourish forever before the Lord.] At II. vespers. Psalm. The Lord said [to my Lord: Sit thou at my right hand: Until I make thy enemies thy footstool...] Blessed is the man [that feareth the Lord: he shall delight exceedingly in his commandments.] Praise [the Lord, ye children: praise ye the name of the Lord.] I have believed, [therefore have I spoken; but I have been humbled exceedingly.] When the Lord brought back [the captivity of Sion, we became like men comforted.] [MY soul doth magnify the Lord, and my spirit hath rejoiced in God my Savior...] Alleluia. I shall liken him to the wise man, who built his house upon a rock.
